description.narrative: The riverside communities are harassed by mega-projects (dams and mines), with risk of grave social and environmental consequences. Community resistance groups have formed to defend free and clean rivers, upon which the cultural heritage of indigenous and agricultural populations largely depend. They seek to take advantage of audiovisual and digital tools to create quarterly 60-minute television programs on social-environmental resistance, especially on violation of human rights of riverside communities caused by the construction of mega-projects. Three 2013 programs will be: 1) Indigenous defense of San Pedro Mazquital river in Nayarit; 2) MAPDER: 10 years defending rivers and free peoples; 3) Conflict, resistance and mining in Mesoamerica
